Author: snakesabu
Content: Recent events really exposed how corrupt our government has become, even more so than usual. I don't see a future going forward with this kind of government, especially with foreign investors prioritizing Vietnam, Thailand, and Phillipines- Indonesia is most likely heading towards a plateu in development and stagnation is the death of all nations, but my question is, what will happen going forwards?

Author: snakesabu
Content: A political purge would be greatly appreciated, but will Prabowo have the guts to pull it off? Something similar to what Xi Jinping did in 2012 could change this overnight, but further clean ups systematically would be necessary and frankly it all depends on how serious the government is at cleaning things up.

Author: p3d_pilot
Content: I think it's more to the corruption just being exposed now, as it slips under JKW's nose.

Author: p3d_pilot
Content: and yes, I do believe that wowo will purge

Author: snakesabu
Content: I agree and personally its somewhat a good news as it gives the impression that the government under Prabowo is aware enough of the problem at hand and is, most importantly, willing to address the issue.

Author: snakesabu
Content: It would be interesting to see, though depending on what methods he chooses, I worry for a potential power vacuum. Indonesians tend to be opportunistic and he is a New Order general with lots of friends.

Author: p3d_pilot
Content: Yeah, but I'm somehow sure that he won't be relating with people that has too much connection with Orba, even though he's a general in Orba
